Reviews.Title: “Good On A Budget”
Reviews.Author: MarkyMark1966
Reviews.Content: You hopefully know what you are getting with Travelodge, a budget hotel, so do not expect many frills if any. The hotel is not very far from Tower Bridge and the Tower Of London. It is just a few minutes walk from the tube as well. The staff were excellent. We had a room on the top floor and heard no noise from outside, even thought there is a busy road and a railway line adjacent. There is a Wetherspoons opposite, so you could go there for breakfast as it is cheaper and better than the hotels. There is a Tesco's around the corner, but it is shut on a Sunday. Only one quibble, and that is with the towels, even though there was two of us in the room, they kept changing the towels and only leaving one bath towel. We had to keep going to reception to get an extra one. Overall recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Some nice touches but a few things let it down”
Reviews.Author: Happydivertraveller
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was a cheap and cheerful option for visiting London's EXCEL. If you can't get into the hotels at EXCEL or they're too expensive, this Travelodge is only a 15-minute ride away on the DLR railway with bed and breakfast for two people on a Saturday night costing less than £120. Tower Bridge is over the road and it is less than a two-minute walk from the nearest Tube station. What we liked: The staff were very friendly, even offering to turn the TV over to my favourite programme when I was the only person in that part of the restaurant, overall cleanliness was excellent, a hairdrier and iron were available to borrow from Reception, kettle with tea and coffee-making facilities in the room, great choice of pub-grub style evening meals served freshly and very quickly at reasonable prices, great choice of food at breakfast, lovely comfortable bed, reasonably sized room, plenty of storage space for an overnight stay, nice shower in the bathroom, room-card controlled security on the bedroom corridoor entrances, nice warm shower, atmospheric lighting in the bedroom and well-stocked vending machines in Reception to satisfy the midnight munchies. What we didn't like: The cracked mirror in the bedroom and the cracked basin in the bathroom. There were only two, thin pillows provided and only one bathtowel and one small towel. The observation is about the room being booked for two but prepared for one person. Only instant coffee is available at breakfast. Top tips: Manage your expectations with a 'no frills' hotel chain - don't forget to pack the toothpaste and all toiletries. They only provide a very small hand soap in the bathroom but this is clearly mentioned on the Travelodge website. Above all, take ear plugs to drown out other people's movements in the corridoors and lots of noise from the street outside, particularly if you like to sleep in late with the windows open. Overall, if you can do that it is a great, cheap and cheerful hotel. We'll stay again when we visit EXCEL.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Danny-Pia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a typical travelodge so you know you will have a basic room with a good nights sleep but the location of this hotel is great. 2 mins from tower bridge, great access to public transport and some nice pubs within very short walking distance. what more could you ask for in London?

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you don't mind the noise!”
Reviews.Author: Welshwhinberry
Reviews.Content: Visiting family in London can be an expensive business if they don't have anywhere to put you up. This Travelodge is situated in a very convenient part of East London, with Tower Bridge and the Tower of London just a stone's throw away; it is also just down the road from where my daughter lives. It is basic accommodation, but everything you need is there, including a very comfortable, large bed. It was very clean and warm, too. Breakfast was included, though I don't think it is always. Again, it was very good, being a buffet-style, where you could eat as much or as little as necessary. Service was polite, cheerful and very efficient. The downside was the very busy road on one side, with frequent sirens at all hours of the day and night and a railway line on the other side. I can imagine that in summer, when you might want to open the windows, things could become unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Knersus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three weeks (yup, a long time!) during summer... At the time there was no aircon in the rooms, lobby or anywhere else in the hotel. The windows can only open very small, so the hotel rooms felt like an oven. When you do open the windows to get a tiny little bit of air in, it also sets off the next problem - noise! The back side of the hotel is next to a railway station, so braking trains screeching sounds until 23:00 every night and from early morning. So I asked to move my room to a street facing room - here it was even worse because the noise from the cars get reflected between the buildings, and their noise keeps going long after 23:00, so the train side was actually better. The room was also very scarce, but had the basics you would expect. Service was ok, but please stay away from the restaurant at all costs where they serve you microwave dinners and charge crazy prices. The location is very good and close to tube stations. If you plan to stay here over the weekend, know that the city is DEAD over weekends with all nearby shots are closed.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Grubby”
Reviews.Author: psybear
Reviews.Content: First off, I want to say that I am under no illusions about what to expect in a Travelodge hotel. I have stayed in various Travelodges previously and, generally speaking, you get what you pay for - no-frills, budget accommodation. I frequently stay in the Travelodge at Southwark and couldn't really complain about it. However this was my first (and hopefully only) ever stay at the Travelodge at London Bridge. I checked in quite late on a Tuesday evening after a vey long and tiring day. At reception they wouldn't give me a breakfast voucher, even though I had an email printout from a booking agency showing that B&B had been booked. The guy on reception was very polite and apologetic, but insisted that I would have to speak with his manager in the morning to get it sorted ( which I did and it was indeed sorted very quickly). I was allocated a room on the 5th floor. I don't know if every floor is the same but there are seriously creaky floorboards both along the length of the corridor and inside my room! Inside the room - electric wall heater which was off, two windows both open - so it was freezing. Closed windows, turned on heater. Tried turning on TV and found that the remote didn't work. It had batteries and a red light indicating power, but it didn't control the TV. Another problem was that there were only a few sheets of toilet roll left on the roll, and no spare roll in the room. I didn't notice this until the next day when (ahem) it really mattered! What really bothered me the most though were the multiple stains on the carpet adjacent to the bed. Without forensic testing I obviously can't be sure, but I'm pretty certain that these were dried bodily fluids. As I really did not want to walk on these in my bare feet I actually moved the bed to cover them - out of sight, out of mind, only they weren't really out of mind.... Normally there would have been enough in the way of problems there for me to have complained at the time and requested a change of room but like I said I was shattered and just wanted to sleep. Unfortunately the hotel is located is very noisy at night, with car horns, police sirens etc going at frequent intervals. Apart from the vile orange juice substitute (common to all Travelodges), breakfast was okay and the breakfast/restaurant area is bright and spacious. I won't be back here....

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Philstowe
Reviews.Content: great budget hotel, in the centre of London. The room was what you would expect from a Travelodge, small and basic, but it was clean and functional. We had a room at the back, by the railway line, but were not disturbed by any train noise. Great situation, only a few minutes walk from tube station and Tower of London We would definitely stay again if coming to London.

Reviews.Title: “good travelodge”
Reviews.Author: haggle
Reviews.Content: this is a very good travelodge close to tube would stay here anytime i was on first floor and no noise.

Reviews.Title: “For a travelodge - very good!!”
Reviews.Author: barney96
Reviews.Content: I have had a lot of bad experiences with Travelodges so although the price was good, I was very apprehensive as to what this place would be like. The room was clean and there was no mould in the bathroom. The mattress was a little bit on the soft side but didn't have any large hollows in (like previous ones). We only had one towel so we asked for another which was fine, but the cleaners obviously don't understand the concept on the tag in the bathroom which says leave your towels on the floor and we will change them, leave them on the rail and we won't. They took both our towels even though they were on the rail, and only replaced them with one, so we had to keep asking for another towel each day. Not very environmentally friendly. There wasn't a hairdryer in the room but you can go and ask and they lend you one. Due to our previous bad experiences of Travelodges, we did not book breakfast, there is however a Wetherspoons at the back which does breakfast very reasonably. The hotel was very easy to find - tube to Tower Bridge, left and round the corner as you leave the station, you see a Minories bar over the road and the Travelodge is behind it. When you get off the tube you will see Tower of London directly in front. The location was ideal to visit most places although be careful at weekends as this is when they close some tube stations for maintenance. We walked to the London Eye, going via the Monument and St Pauls, it was quite a way but it was a nice day. We walked back along the Thames and there were some lovely rivers edge bars to stop at and we crossed back over Tower bridge. Because the Tower is so close, visit it in the morning and make sure you do the jewels bit early as by the time we came out there were huge queues and it wasn't even a busy time of year! If you are just looking for a base, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “If you are on a budget this is great value”
Reviews.Author: jayteel
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about staying in another Travelodge and especially in London. To my suprise the Hotel is located very close to the tube station and main railway station. As previously stated the rooms are small, very basic, one pillow each, very soft mattress - I was honestly so exhausted after a day sightseeing though, it didn't seem to matter too much. What I didn't like about it was there is no provision of soap, and the most minimum amount of toilet paper I have ever seen (even public toilets make a good provision of these), only one hand and one bath towel (tricky if there is two of you). It is close to a number of restaurants and for sightseeing you are within walking distance of Tower Bridge and the Tower of London. Also Very close to reasonable amentities. Just remember your toiletries

Reviews.Title: “Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Emma P
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times as it is close to work and we always enjoy it here. The food is good and love the 24 hour pizzas on offer.

Reviews.Title: “For the money - a great base!”
Reviews.Author: +PrincessSarah+
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small and basic (no bath - just a shower/no curtains - just a blind, no toiletries etc) but if you are after somewhere cheap for a base then this is perfect. The rooms are clean and although we were on the 3rd floor overlooking the railway, the room was quiet and I experienced no noise. The beds are very soft - a bit like marshmallows - but I got a fairly decent nights sleep nethertheless. There is a bar downstairs which serves drinks and food (pizza 24hours a day!) and breakfast. We never had a breakfast here and chose to eat at the weatherspoons which is literally accross the road and very cheap. Hotel is 2 mins walk to tube station so we found this a great base to get around. One gripe is that we arrived an hour early and even though our rooms were ready - the hotel wanted an extra £10 for us to check in. They wouldnt even let us drop our bags off. This wasnt a major problem for us but something to be aware of! Dont get me wrong - Ive stayed in much nicer hotels in London but all in all, a good cheap base - We got a room here for £40 a night during the travelodge sale...for that price and I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok?!”
Reviews.Author: lrw0812
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night to make a trip of it as was spending following day in london for my partners birthday. For the price it was probably value for money! Room small and basic but we only needed it to sleep in for the one night! Was lovely and warm though and bed comfy although soft! We came in late one night and were slightly dipsy and hungry haha and the kind man in reception cooked a pizza for us! We also hassled him for an extra duvet - which was not needed in the end and another pillow. All this was around mid night and housekeepers had gone home so he fetched from another room. Other staff minus him, i found quite blunt, no smile or effort to make conversation or make you feel valued or welcome. Breakfast was average, wish we hadnt pre paid for that and had it in the pub place over the road instead. Probably wouldnt stay again, id like to go more in the city next time as the location wasnt great for the reasons for my visit.

Reviews.Title: “great location. value for money..”
Reviews.Author: kaMeO_13
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights. again, the check in was simple and fast.. we got room at level 5 facing the rail station. some review mentioned that avoid rooms facing rail station but so far, it works fine for us..  the room was small but just enough. bathroom clean. everything was okay..  near to london tube station tower hill. walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as last time”
Reviews.Author: janecad
Reviews.Content: We stayed 29/30 Jan. Had room 110 at the back but no problem at all with any noise from DLR or fellow customers. It does need a good deep clean now though. The carpets are needing more than a vacuum can do and in the bath room, places like where the hand rail attatches to the tiles and the seal around the shower could use a steam clean. The buttons on the shower taps were missing. (Come on Travelodge, don't let it slip too far as you are on to a good thing here.) Staff that we saw were friendly and helpful. We didn't have breakfast there but from what we saw, not many people did. Would we stay again?-yes- but if they haven't stopped the standard from slipping then the next stay will be the last one The Wetherspoon's accross the road do a lovely breakfast, well cooked, good portions and nice and hot.

Reviews.Title: “mid range travelodge - breakfast not so good”
Reviews.Author: percynorthants
Reviews.Content: good site, and at the right price, good value. clean & tidy, civil staff, large rooms. Even though we were on the road side, the double glazing prevent too much noise and we were not disturbed. Having had the TL breakfast on a number of occasions, can confidently say this was the poorest - less choice and the cooked was poorly presented and with cracked tray lids that made it all seem a bit tacky - but then we had only paid £40 including 2 breakfasts on a Sunday night, so really no reason to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Katelcowley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel and I would fully recommend it. Great location for the sights and the tube, quiet area (our room was on the train side of the hotel and we weren't bothered by the noise at all) and all the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “2 days break in london”
Reviews.Author: rosalind a
Reviews.Content: although a bit hard to locate when we reached the reception the friendly welcome made up for a lot. staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble, great little pub next door if you don't want to eat in the travelodge if only all travelodges were the same, just a note take your own shampoo

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: walkingsue
Reviews.Content: second visit, room at front on first floor - clean and plenty big enough. Staff all very friendly and helpful. will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Cheap n Cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: LUFCPAULS
Reviews.Content: Great loaction, about 2 mins from the tube and from the tower. Staff where friendly Only bad side was the bed felt like it had collapsed in the middle. Would go again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Iced_Jelly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Travelodge from the 15th January - 18th January for just over £60 (Travelodge sale) which considering its location is an amazing deal. We checked in fine at 3pm, the room is a typical Travelodge room, large double bed, small en suite, desk, mirror, TV, hangers etc. The en suite was great, lots of hot water and pressure, the mattress on the bed unfortunately was incredibly soft which is fine if your used to that. Saying that though we found our room to be very clean. As has been mentioned, this Travelodge backs onto a railway line and road. Our room backed onto the railway, and although you could hear the old train the windows do keep out the majority of noise, but I'm sure in summer when you want the window open, this could be annoying so take ear plugs just in case. The only other slightly annoying thing other than the mattress and there only being one two socket plug, was the cleaners knocking on your door at 9.30am. I'm sure this is fine if your there on business which I would say the majority of customers to this hotel are visiting for, but if you spent the previous day sight seeing and want a little in sleep or are in the shower its annoying. It's a shame they didn't have a do not disturb sign as this would have been useful! Just a little tip although Tower Hill tube station is closer, Aldgate tube station has a Boots chemist and a small Tesco near it which is handy. Tower Hill has restaurants and a wetherspoons nearby. All in all a cheap stay in a central hotel and I would recommend, but bare in mind the above in case your either a light sleeper or a used to a firm mattress.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city for the good price”
Reviews.Author: lilia_Davies
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Everything in the hotel seems very tired and the breakfast definately worth to MISS, as it was no good for the same price as you could by a full nice English breakfast in a nearby pub. Also, don't forget to put the soap etc, as it doesn't include in price.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: anwo1980
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for one night on business, you get what you pay for, when I got to room it smelled of smoke and had a sock over the fire alarm sensor which should have tidied up, probably wouldn't stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: CarannSheffield
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my business trip was booked at short notice, so my usual hotel in Kensington was full and I ended up here. I've stayed in Travelodges before and they're okay. The Tower Bridge one is close to Tower Hill station (but this site gives better walking directions than their own website - for anyone not wanting to get lost because the Goodmans Yard roadsign is currently (January 2012) hidden behind scaffolding, leave Tower Hill tube by the exit pointing to DLR, turn left (you can see the Tower across the river to the right, very pretty), cross the road at the crossing, but walk past the DLR entrance to where The Minories pub is, then turn right and the Travelodge is a hundred yards or so after the Minories' outside tables/benches. The room was the usual basic, but everything was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. My room was on the fourth floor, on the side facing Goodmans Yard, which is a main road (four lanes), so very busy and traffic could be heard and I was also woken up one night (morning) at 5am by inconsiderate cardrivers sounding their horns. They only give you one hand and one bath towel - I have long, thick hair and a hand towel is inadequate. I was given a further bath tower when I requested one, but for some strange reason, the cleaners removed the additional towel after two days. Small tv, the "guide" button didn't work and it only had 12 channels (yes, I know we're all spoilt nowadays, I remember when we only had two) - petty, I know, but when you're visiting for work and you're tired after working a long day, it would be nice to (a) have a better choice and (b) to be able to see what's on. So, all in all - adequate. I'd use it again if I had to, but never if the Copthorne Tara at Kensington has any rooms available!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and clean & friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Emma A
Reviews.Content: Clean and surprisingly quiet even though we were on the 2nd floor. We could see the traffic but not hear it. Bonus. Stayed on the 27th December and the facilities were perfectly adequate and comfortable. A bar and cafe downstairs if you wanted food, internet access to stay in touch if you needed. 12pm check out was great after a late night in the City. The only slight issue I have is with the chambermaids who were insistent on coming in about 3 times to see if they could clean the room. I would recommend the hotel purchases some 'Do Not Disturb' door hangers for those wanting a lie in. The cost was a bargain at £25 for the 2 of us to stay for 1 night. Try and get the £10 a night offers on their website, this was definitely a bonus and we enjoyed our trip. I would recommend this Travelodge for people on a short trip to London and no more than a few days as the room was probably a little small for lots of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: andygibbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 6th and 7th jan ( it cost £102 for friday and saturday ) and have got to say it was a great surprise ,room spotlessly clean and helpful staff . Its really close to Tower Hill tube station , come out the station follow the sign for tower gate ( DLR ) as you turn the corner u see tower gate and the pub The Minories , go under the archway nxt to minories and turn right and ur at the hotel . The Minories is a really good pub , and they serve a gret breakfast a

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: kevr39
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 5 minutes walk from tower hill underground and close to the Tower of London, Tower Bridge and St Katharine's dock, there are a number of bars and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel is typical travelodge with it's modern and minimalist design. The welcome when booking in was friendly as was service throughout my stay. The reception has a couple of vending machines serving soft drinks, snacks and toiletries, there is also a tea/coffee machine and a stand with tourist leaflets. Around the side from reception is the bar and restaurant which serves alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks and meals from 5pm to 11pm which were reasonably priced compared to nearby venues. The room is rather spartan though functional, it hadn't been vacuum for some time and neither had the corridor outside. The bed was soft yet surprisingly comfortable, I prefer a firm mattress though I didn't have any trouble sleeping. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of hot water, though travelodge don't provide toilietries. Facilities in the room comprise a kettle with tea & coffee, a TV with a number of freeview channels and a shelf and clothes hanging rail. Although my room overlooked the railway it wasn't that noisy. Overall I had a pleasant stay and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fosters123
Reviews.Content: Arrived an hour early but there was no chance that we were going to get our room, we were directed to the expensive bar. Not a problem. Got to the room and it was fine. Nice, fresh, clean and tidy. Only problem was, we were put on the side of the trains/tubes so that was a bit noisy. As we left we informed the 'desk' that we had no toilet roll, they said hang on and we will get you some, I said nah,we are off out can you just put some in our room please.Yes, they replied.We returned to no loo roll and I had to run down and get some! Also the free tea, coffee and milk had not been replenished. In short Hotel is in a great spot and very clean. Staff are urine poor.Cleaners are fine but they need to replenish tea, sugar etc but reception staff were terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: freddymercuryBristol
Reviews.Content: This travelodge was well worth the money - we only paid £12 per night plus a £10 early check in. It was clean. I stayed for 2 nights and had 2 nights of good sleep. £7.65 for breakfast and I certainly got my moneys worth from a reasonably good selection. I had a bit of an argument when I asked for an extra pillow but the boy behind the desk recovered well and I got 2. The young staff were very pleasant and helpful. I am under no illusions about Travelodge but for £12 a night in London - it was value for money

Reviews.Title: “Usual Travelodge Experience”
Reviews.Author: Treborwf
Reviews.Content: The reception and bar staff very welcoming. Usual Travelodge room standard of minimum furniture and basic no frills. Room was clean apart from weird stains in the carpet, cracked mirror and there was only 1 bath towel for the 2 of us. We ate breakfast and dinner at the hotel, nothing fantastic but adequate basic food. Our 2nd floor room faced the street and we were not disturbed by any noise. Didn’t have my laptop, but noticed a sign saying they charged for wifi in the rooms and another sign saying free within the bar area. There are 2 computers at reception where internet access is £1 for 20 minutes. Snacks and drinks machines were also located by reception. Decided upon this hotel because of the location, only a 5 minute walk to the Tower of London and the special £15 deal during their sale.

Reviews.Title: “Grim & Depressing”
Reviews.Author: Mdruk
Reviews.Content: As a regular business traveller who has to use budget hotels, I had no unrealistic expectations when I checked into Travelodge Tower Bridge, London. All I wanted was a room that was clean and functional. Sadly, this Travelodge failed to deliver on both counts. My small room on the 4th floor looked tired, every wall was grubby, and a tennis ball-sized hole in the plasterwork had been crudely filled. There was an unpleasant stain on the carpet by the side of the bed. I didn’t get close enough to examine what had caused it! The grubby windows opened by about one inch and overlooked offices and several lanes of very noisy traffic (apparently this is the best side of the Travelodge, as the rear backs directly onto a rail line). The bed was incredibly saggy and unsupportive and there were a worrying amount of stains, and what looked like cigarette burn marks on the duvet (strange, as Travelodge has been non-smoking for some time – so how old is the linen?). The pillows were wafer-thin, but worse was the constant scuttling in the cavity wall during the night. The noise could do with being investigated by Rentokil. After an awful night’s sleep I looked forward to a shower in the relatively modern but small bathroom. Sadly, this was a disappointment, too. The shower only had one setting: so hot it almost burned your skin off. No amount of turning the thermostat down altered the temperature. I didn’t appreciate seeing long hair from a previous guest stuck to the tiles, and mould growing around the base of the shower tray. Could breakfast be this hotel’s saving grace? I’m afraid not. You have to queue and are presented with a knife, fork and plate. The buffet offered a miserable selection of sausages, scrambled eggs and cooked tomatoes – it looked like it had all been microwaved several hours ago. So I decided to give it a miss and settled for a stale croissant and a self-service slice of toast. Only in central London could Travelodge get away with charging £99.95 (plus an extra £7.95 for breakfast) for such a poorly maintained, scruffy and depressing hotel. It’s not cheap, it’s certainly not cheerful, and my advice would be to pay a bit more for a Premier Inn.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Foybes
Reviews.Content: Don’t get me wrong I know that the Travelodge chain is a value chain and you do get what you pay for, no frills is expected but I do expect some basics comforts…like warmth It’s December, there was ice on my car windscreen when I set off to work; it’s cold but expected, its winter I have a winter coat on, gloves and a scarf. Most of the day the temperature has struggled to get near 10oC and by the time I arrive in the early evening, having arrived in London by train, there is a definite chill in the air. So it begs the question why the heating in my hotel room is turned off, its England, its winter, its not like the hotel have got caught out with a sudden cold snap – its December! The room is colder than my refrigerator; I half expect David Attenborough and the Frozen Plant team to pop up filming some penguins and polar bears. Its not just mine when I checked in another guest was complaining that their heater would not turn on – a known fault apparently but they still let the room. 3 hours later having had the small electric heater on max the room is warmer but not what I would really call comfortably warm; the heater stays on all night – still not very warm by morning. Then there is the quilt; it is thinner than my suit jacket! Fortunately it’s a double and there is only me so I can double it up like a sleeping bag; not a cosy night sleep at all. But surely in December I could expect a winter quit, or a blanket or two. Oh and did I mention it is a double room – so why then is there only 3 pillows – what is that about. Also my room overlooked a railway line and station so was quite noisy in the evening and early morning but the website did say “some” rooms overlooked the railway – I estimate that over-half of the rooms do so be honest! To be fair to the hotel, it’s not all bad. My room is clean and functional, as is the bathroom, no bath but a decent shower and again clean. Breakfast is also good, the bacon is undercooked for my taste but that is a personal preference. The staff are also helpful and friendly at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “travelodge london tower bridge”
Reviews.Author: welshmother3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in November. Usual style of rooms/bathroom with little furniture but very clean/modern, flat screen tv. Our room facing main street but no noise from traffic. Reception staff very welcoming. Only complaint with the travelodge range of hotels is that no cupboards, drawers are provided which would be very useful when staying more than1 night. Having to put shopping etc on floor.very untidy. Good location few mnutes from tower of london, tower gateway dlr and tower tube. 2 wetherspoons near..

Reviews.Title: “Good VFM budget hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: LiveaxleDD
Reviews.Content: It's a Travelodge!! You know what you're getting....... clean basic acomodation at a budget price, Located within walking distance of the tower of London and Tower Hill tube station we found it a Ideal base for a 3 night break in the city, no complaints and would use it again. The pub next door (the Minories)did a very reasonably priced breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, basic budget stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kentish_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed a single night for a business meeting the following day. The hotel was well located close to the financial district of London and a three minute walk from Tower Bridge tube station. The staff were welcoming and friendly and quickly served you. The room was exceptionally basic but expected at the budget price. The room was well lit, had double windows to effectively keep out any noise and a good-sized bed (although the mattress was a little too soft for me). The bathroom was clean and bright with a good shower. Guests should note that you should bring your own toiletries because only a very small bar of soap is provided - but they do tell you this on their website. I had a comfortable and quiet night's sleep. Breakfast (extortionately priced as usual) was a very mediocre buffet serving traditional English and Continental breakfasts. If it wasn't quite so convenient, I wouldn't recommend the breakfast. Although more expensive than this Travelodge, I would recommend Premier Inn as an alternative option - the larger price does translate to more comfortable accommodation. BUT If you're looking for a cheap night in a well-located spot of London, with absolutely no thrills, you still can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Franz_Zena
Reviews.Content: I spent just a single night in this hotel. I've to say that the area surrounding the hotel is quite dark at night. I mean, not many bars and clubs are there around. Said this, the staff of the hotel was really nice, the rooms were beautiful and clean. The problem was with the sleeping. The hotel was quite noisy. It felt, somehow, like the roof was creaking any time the guys of the upper floor were walking around the room or down the corridor. Anyway, it's still a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fab location”
Reviews.Author: pompey1001
Reviews.Content: The staff at this London hotel were exceptional. All the staff greeted us when they saw us, and nothing was too much trouble. The room was small but very clean. The Location is brilliant, near the tube and Tower Bridge. We will be going back, excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “5 star location for a Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: jaysouthuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just around the corner from Tower Hill underground station. The building itself is not as old as some Travelodge buildings and of course is typically Travelodge style inside. Some rooms overlook the main road at the front of the building and the rooms at the rear overlook the railway line. If you want a view ask for a high floor room as if you get a low floor room at the back you will be looking at a brick wall with the railway line above. The big bonus was across the road is a Weatherspoons Pub “Goodmans Yard” which is ideal for breakfast, lunch, dinner and a night out at reasonable cost. I did feel sorry for the people eating breakfast in the Travelodge unaware of what they could have had just a short walk along the street and at more affordable price. Tower Bridge is just a short walk away, so no problem getting to the river sidewalks, south bank, HMS Belfast and London Eye etc… If you want a London Travelodge (being aware of Travelodge standards) then you should go for this Travelodge every time. Will defiantly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money......but too hot!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RedcarSunlovers
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in excellent setting, literally 2 mins walk from tower bridge. The only fault we had with this hotel was the weekend we were there it was very hot and the hotel has no air conditioning in the rooms. They gave us a fan but to be honest was hardly any help!!!!!!!!! I actually complained about the fact the windows only open a couple of inches and ther's no ventilation at all in the hotel!!!!!! But like i said the hotel is ideal for seeing London............MINORIES pub brilliant food and by far did a more superior breakfast!!!!!! So yes i would stay again but hopefully weather wouldn't be as hot.....lol!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: PaintedNails
Reviews.Content: I am a little late in reviewing this hotel as my friend and I stayed here in August for a London shopping weekend. You cannot beat the location of this hotel. If you are a sightseer, The Tower of London is a stones throw away. If you are in London for shopping, etc there is excellent public transport all around the hotel. The staff are extremely accomodating. My friend has a fear of heights and so the staff put us in a ground floor room to help us out. They didn't have to do that but wanted to make sure we were comfortable. There is air conditioning also in the ground floor rooms, but none in the upper floor rooms so we were able to avail of the air conditioning. The breakfast was a good addition and was sufficient for our needs. I just cannot find fault with this hotel. It was clean, great location and the staff are superb. As two women in the city we felt perfectly safe in this hotel and walking the neighborhood at night. We got an extremely cheap rate thru ASDA travel and paid well below what the hotel rate was advertised. I recommend this hotel and will use it again next shopping trip over. There is a train line running behind the hotel. We never heard the train though as we were located at the front of the hotel. There is a pub directly next door, The Minories. I have to say we hated this pub. The staff at the Minories are horrendous and it took at least 15 minutes just to get the barmaids attention to get served. But that being said the Minories has no affilitation with the Hotel and so really shouldn't be included in this review. I just mention it in case you stay at the hotel. There are much friendlier and better pubs in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: IomManxie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location and I could not fault my first visit. Just had my second visit, and whilst it is cheap and cheerful, I was disappointed to be allocated a room that hadn't been cleaned. It was quickly resolved. My room on the 4th floor, was no where near as good as the one on the 1st floor from my first visit. But, it does beat paying £200 a night for accomodation that really isn't that much better! The rooms are very warm. One tip - I would recommend requesting a room on the front of the hotel, as the back over looks the DLR railway and is a bit noisy! The pub next door - THe Minories is great too!!

Reviews.Title: “The offer of a hostel for more than 100£. At least it's clean”
Reviews.Author: Veleno75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-located in the City, and the rooms are very clean. And this is all the good I can tell about this hotel. The room is... well, poorly furnished wouldn't give the idea: is more like a cell of a monk. You have NO space where to put anything. Then, there are no toiletries, so you have to bring your own shampoo... and if you fly you have then to board your luggage. And there is no luggage service too!! So if you mean to leave and come back... you can't leave them your suitcase!! And what about the "free wi-fi" in the hall? It just wasn't working. And every day they told us it would have been fixed the day after, but after five days I told them to remove all the cardboards in the lounge that were telling about the "Free wi-fi", because they were just lies (and they did it...). Last touch: I had to leave at 8am on Saturday, so at 7.30 I went to breakfast... only to find out that just on Saturday breakfast was from 8... BUT THEY DIDN'T TELL! Ok all of these things would even be tolerable, if I was paying for a hostel: but we paid 110£ per night!

Reviews.Title: “No frills but good location”
Reviews.Author: rollergirl52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights to do some sightseeing - got it for £39 per night so can't really complain. Room was very basic and small but clean and comfortable though not even any soap in the bathroom. Our room overlooked the DLR railway and was very noisy from early morning till late at night so we had to keep the window shut. Even so we were woken very early by the trains. Location is great though, right next to the Tower of London and Tower Bridge and 2 minutes walk to Tower Hill tube station. There is not much in the surrounding area as it is mainly a business area but there is a pub next door, the Minories which did a good vegetarian lasagne though food stops at 9pm. Also there is a small Tesco Express just round the corner so I got snacks and drinks for breakfast from there. Walking round the area late at night did not feel too comfortable but during the day there are a number of cafes and sandwich bars open which cater for the offices in the area. At this price would definitely stay again if visiting London, it's a good base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “~ Great Location, Reasonable price ~”
Reviews.Author: Linna1437
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night is £49.50/night. Hotel is located for TOWER hill Tube and DLR lines, both walk within 2 minutes only. Room was well proportioned with Air Conditioning.. At the end of the day it is a Travelodge so don't expect 'extras' either in your room or in the hotel. For an extra £20-40pn you can find better, but this is a trade off against location.

Reviews.Title: “Did the Job”
Reviews.Author: Meebleshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Saturday night and the hotel was absolutely fine. Spent ages trying to find somewhere in a good location (we were attending a concert in Brixton) which was reasonably priced. When booking it was £80 which zoomed up to £170 on the website so ended up booking by phone and got the original price, though I did incur an admin fee. After reading the reviews we requested a road-side room which was granted, on the 3rd floor. It's true that the double glazing is effective as we didn't hear a thing apart from the odd siren. The room was very stuffy and it has to be said that it is noisy once the window's opened the teeny bit the lock allows. The room is indeed very sparse but for one night's kip it was OK. No probs with soap and towels, there was a small bar of soap and 2 bath towels provided, along with extra pillows. I had to wedge myself kneeling on the sofa bed to reach the mirror to apply make up being short sighted, which was a pain in the neck, and others' comments about the mirrors and lack of power sockets are correct. There were some nasty looking marks on the sofa bed which weren't at all pleasant.... Parking at the next door multi storey was cheap which was a nice surprise. Loved the Minories pub next door (in the railway arches) and would've had breakfast there had I not pre-booked. Brekkie was fine though, a decent fry-up after a night's concert and several beers. We wouldn't have eaten at the hotel though, would've gone to the Minories pub instead. Fab location just a couple of mins from Tower Hill tube. Had a lovely walk over Tower Bridge on the Sunday morning and would stay again to do some sightseeing, though not if I was being charged £170 as the website was intending! By the way, wasn't keen on the 'register at the desk for breakfast' in the dining room, when you were handed your plate and cutlery - felt a bit like you were at an army camp or back in a school canteen!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Marc C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 4 nights on business. Hotel is well located for Tower Hill tube and DLR lines, both within 2 minutes walk. Room was well proportioned with Air conditioning although very sparse and bland. Could have done with an in room safe or lockable storage as being on the ground floor looking out in to an alley I felt a little uneasy about leaving valuables in the room. Staffing is a little sparse so expect a wait when checking or requiring service. At the end of the day it is a Travelodge so don't expect 'extras' either in your room or in the hotel. For an extra £20-40pn you can find better, but this is a trade off against location.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst”
Reviews.Author: cullodenmist
Reviews.Content: We arrived one hour early and after waiting at an unattended desk we were eventually told it would cost us 10 pound to leave our luggage in the hotel to booking in time. . We had a room that overlooked the railway station with a large number of train lines. . It was the hottest Sept day in the UK's history with no air-conditioning in the room. When asking for a fan we were told that the hotel didn't have any. . Sleeping was nonexistent as the option was to leave the windows open for a cool breeze and put up with the railway shunting of trains all night or keep the noise out by having the window closed and sweltering due to the build up of heat in the small room with no cooling. . With no mini fridge in the room I had to leave my medication in the main hotel kitchen, but on departure the hotel staff could not fine it until a search was underway. . The use of the hotel PC to upload and save digital photographs was nonexistent as the PC was only for the internet and that was after giving personal information to get your usage approved.

Reviews.Title: “Poor maintenance and basic”
Reviews.Author: fbowles
Reviews.Content: Booked in at a corporate rate of £80, was in a ground floor room which was large and featureless. As seems to be the way in Travelodges now shower has no shower gel or anything to wash hair with. Mirror in room was cracked and on a very hot night the air conditioning unit was no use as it dripped water loudly on to the carpet. Having paid £10 less for a four star country house hotel (albeit in Ipswich) the night before brought home how horrid and faceless London can be.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TrezSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: For the princely sum of 85 pounds for 1 nights accommodation, this hotel or lodge( call it what you want) was well below par. Bed was like hammock and the pillows were like stuffed bean bags. Although the room was clean, one pays money primarily for a good nights rest, which was difficult to achieve, due to the uncomfortable bed and noisy railway line next to my window. A park bench would be better value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend”
Reviews.Author: nettyNottingham
Reviews.Content: Netty Nottingham Had a nice weekend stay at this Travelodge, 7th to 9th October, would stay again for sure, very clean.We had room no 227 very quite with windows shut but very hot. We had a nice breakfast both mornings we were there. The only problem was the juice glasses would look a lot nicer if washed by hand better then putting in dishwasher.It was a nice Travelodge and area to have a short break in London.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thundercatsgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 5th October for 3 nights. It was a bargain at just under £100 for the 3 nights. We were on the 5th floor and facing the railway line. Althought it was a little noisy at times it didnt really bother us as we were only in the room at night. It didnt bother us when sleeping. We didnt bother with breakfast as they were charging £7.95 each and the pub across the road called the Minories did breakfast for £4.00 which was fab. If you want a cheap hotel for doing some sightseeing this one is good. It was a little hot in the room but that didnt really bother us. It was clean and did the job !!! We would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “London Hothouse”
Reviews.Author: Roytoners
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights on business. The hotel is basic, clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The main problem was the lack of ventilation in the room and the dreadful noise from the adjacent railway station. It was so hot in the room that without aircon I was forced to open the window to let in some cooler air. The noise from the trains was then unbearable so I closed the windows and became uncomfortably hot! Surely, after reading many other reviews stating the same problem Travelodge would do something about an obvious drawback to the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Basic but great location”
Reviews.Author: TAMember51
Reviews.Content: We stopped here over a weekend at the end of September. The location is great, just 2 minutes walk from the Tower of London, on the edge of the financial district. Rooms are basic but have everything that you need for a short stay in London. The room was very clean but the drawback was the heat. Admittedly we were there on the hottest weekend of the year, but we found it impossible to sleep as the room was so very warm. We had a room on the 4th floor on the DLR side so expected noise. We had to leave the window open during the night to try to let a bit of air in but still found it far too warm. It is worth noting that the local pubs and businesses all seemed to be closed on a Saturday and Sunday - I guess there are no city traders to be open for. It isn't a problem as there are plenty of places to eat on the other side of the River over Tower Bridge or in St Katherines Docks. All in all if you are after a hotel to sleep and shower in whilst you are sightseeing in London (and it is not too hot outside) this is a great place to stop.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely basic hotel with poor service.”
Reviews.Author: MarkInBali
Reviews.Content: The entire stay was extremely disappointing. It all started to go wrong on check-in, we dared to try to check-in a mere 20 minutes before the designated check-in time, to which I was informed I could only check-in early if I paid an addition ten pounds, and that I would have to go away and come back 20 minutes later. Next the room was so basic, not even a wardrobe or drawers for clothes. On the second morning I need to print some documents urgently, to which I was told they had no printing facilities, and the nearest place to print anything was 20 minutes walk away. I am sorry, but I find it hard to believe that they did not have a single working printer anywhere in the hotel that could not print two pages of test for me. Then on the day of check-out, I could only get a late check-out until 2pm, and then only if I paid, and they had no facilities to leave a couple of small bags, forcing me to carry three bags, including my computer, around London for the day until my flight in the evening. All in all, not a place I would recomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sights of London”
Reviews.Author: GringoUK
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Travelodge in Tower bridge area of London. Great location for Tower of London, Jack the Ripper walk and River cruises. 5 minute walk from tube station and all attractions mentioned above. The hotel itself is usual affair, quite noisy rooms whichever side you stay on but we slept no problem. Rooms are very warm as the norm with Travelodge but I think they have fans available. We luckily didn't need one on this occasion. 2 places to have a drink/eat I recommend - The Weatherspoons pub opposite the Tower, beautiful views at night when the Tower and the bridge are lit up. The Minories pub for breakfast is a must £5.99 for big breakfast and drink - one of the best I have had!

Reviews.Title: “travelodge towerhill”
Reviews.Author: allison2010
Reviews.Content: just returned from travelodge towerhill and once again had a fantastic stay. warm welcome from staff and rooms cleaned daily, great value for money can't wait to return next year, if the traffic is busy then close the windows.tower hill just around the corner.we won't stay anywhere else, love it.

Reviews.Title: “Super-soft bed let me down”
Reviews.Author: DurbanDweller
Reviews.Content: I chose this TLodge as I heard it had aircon (albeit on the ground floor only). I was nervous that the proximity to the rail line (DLR) would prove noisy but I was pleasantly surprised. Room 11, ground floor, facing the back not the road. Perfectly quiet. Private. Below the DLR so no noise. As with all TLodges, it was very basic, but ok (I still don't get why they can't give you shampoo). The big let down of my 2-night stay was the very very soft bed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our one night here”
Reviews.Author: rosie503717
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our one night here before moving to Covent garden Travelodge, Very nice room on ground floor room 5 everything was spot on and very clean, Never heard any noise at night. Would have been good to know Tower Hill was nearest tube as we went to wrong stop when we arrived but with help from friendly London cab driver found it ok.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Utilitarian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caroline186225
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel this weekend to attend the Open House event in London. Hotel is a basic utilitarian hotel, furnished with fake wood furniture, plastic chair and a small hanging rail for clothes with shelf above. No side tables beside the bed but a very small cubby hole set into the headboard. Small room with a small en- suite, not much space to store baggage etc. The hotel does not appear to have a luggage room and will not accept baggage prior to/ after check in/ check out. So you have to plan your stay around this. It is in a rather noisy location, with the light rail on one side and a noisy arterial road on the other, which was busy all night. If you are a tourist, the hotel location is ideal for seeing the Tower etc,however be warned that at the weekend this part of the city is essentially "dead" with cafes closed, also shops as well, which was rather surprising. A better location is the Covent Garden travel lodge, which again is a basic utilitarian hotel but with a great location. The front of house staff in the Tower Hill location are friendly and helpful, apart from a rather diembodied voice which kept calling out to the reception staff when we tried to verify our booking on arrival at the hotel, "charge them ten pounds" this was at ten minutes to the regular check in time. I declined and waited the ten minutes and then booked in. Not a great service example to the front of house staff from ? a manager on duty. Also of note is that the electrical socket in the room was hanging out of the wall and the reading lights attached to the headboard were somewhat loose. There is a good flat screen TV in the room, the shower in the ensuite was adequate. The hotel is in a good location for a buisness traveller who needs access to the city during the week. Will we stay again...very unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, good staff. Shame about the railway!”
Reviews.Author: ufojosh
Reviews.Content: I was in London on business so didn't get to choose my hotel. When I found out it was Travelodge Tower Hill I came straight to TripAdvisor and read the reviews, it concerned me slightly but I was pleasantly surprised. It is a 1 minute walk from Tower Gateway (DLR) and about 3-5minutes to Tower Hill, if you walk London style! It is a 10minute walk to Bank so really close to 'the city' making it perfect for Business travellers and the proximity to attractions such as Tower Bridge make it ideal for Tourists. The rooms are basic as you would expect but all have a desk, chair, full height mirror & a flat screen colour TV. The room was spotless when I arrived, strangely they only give you 3 pillows despite it being a double bed but the staff are more than happy to help with any requests so getting another wasn't a problem. The rooms are cleaned daily and and towels replaced as was the bar of soap (the only toiletry the provide, I find it strange how they claim they cannot provide Shampoo because it would be too expensive but can afford to replace the bar of soap everyday). My room was facing the railway line and was incredibly hot. You can hardly hear the trains when the windows are shut. To overcome the heat issue I left the windows open all day and closed them just before bed, I asked reception about this and they offered me a fan which did the job. Apart from the proximity to the railway line (which isn't a massive problem for a short stay) I can't fault anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kelly815
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance to tower bridge and the tower of London. There are two tube stations nearby. After reading the reviews on here we requested a room on the road side. The room was basic but clean. The light behind the bed didn't work and the side lamps were a bit dodgy but apart from that everything was fine. We had to ask for extra pillows but the bed was quiet comfy. We didn't have any distuarbance from outside noise. Also there wasn't a hairdryer in the room but if you ask at reception they will give you one. Overall this hotel is very good value for money if you just want somewhere to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend staying in hot weather!”
Reviews.Author: AshNE
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my daughter and a friend with her daughter for a summer holiday trip to London. It was a warm couple of days but the temperature in the hotel was unbearable. The windows opened only a fraction, and the 4 train lines behind the hotel were so noisy to make this prohibitive anyway. Despite several requests my daughter and I had to share 1 towel for our stay. The only saving grace was the friendliness of the breakfast staff who were more than helpful offering tourist and travel tips. Maybe Travelodge should extend their training to the rest of the team!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: shazzabCornwall
Reviews.Content: great location, helpful staff, clean, good size rooms, food and drink reasonable prices, good pub nextdoor serving really good food a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: deedeeGrimsby
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the usual Travel Lodge set-up it's all fairly basic but with a clean bed, shower room, flat screen TV and kettle there's all you need for a short stay. Remember to take a hairdryer and a make-up mirror as they don't have these (though there's a full length mirror in the room + one in the shower-room). I did miss having a drawer for my make-up and hair things but it was a brilliant price so I can't complain. There's a quiet pub right on the doorstep which is nice to sit outside and enjoy a coffee or any other drink. A couple of hundred yards away is a decent Wetherspoons and just across from that is a Tesco Express (for a sandwich etc) with an ATM right outside of it. You are a couple of minutes from the Thames and the bridge and Tube so an all round good location. The staff were very friendly and helpful too!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Smudger265
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what people expect really. I paid £140 for 3 nights in August, and thought that it was excellent value. My room (316) was right next to the train tracks, but with the windows shut they caused us know disturbance. We were provided with a fan, but didn't need it. Central London is noisy, but this hotel with it's triple glazing did a good job of keeping it out. I don't know how people can praise a hotel for being right next to a train station and in the next sentence criticise it for the same thing! The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly, the beds are comfortable, the transport links are excellent, yes there is going to be noise, but that tends to be the case in Central London! The minories pub over the road is worth a mention too; bacon sandwich and a coffee is £2.50!

Reviews.Title: “Will look elsewhere next time!”
Reviews.Author: jrburrows
Reviews.Content: The location was probably the best thing about it, however the hotel was extremely basic. The room which I stayed in had a certain stench about it, and also the service was not up to scratch - including an employee, not knocking before entering the room. It was just somewhere to sleep mainly, but extremely basic.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic rooms but good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hjpireland
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very basic and window overlooked a dirty alley. There was quiet a bit of noise at night but luckly we can sleep through anything. The noise may have been due to the fact that it was very warm and we had to leave the window open. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the guy on the front desk when we arrived. The breakfast was buffet style and there was a good selection i.e. cereal, toast, fruit, muffins and hot food. The location is very good for visiting the tower of london, just around the corner. It is also just a bus ride into Trafalgar Square, Westminster, etc. A good hotel to use as a base to put your head down, as long as you are not spending much time at the actual hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some major flaws ruin a standard city hotel”
Reviews.Author: agrice_3
Reviews.Content: Firstly this room was a bargain at an Internet sale price of £15 per night. Room was very clean and the general location, being close to Tower Hill tube station and five minutes to Tower Bridge, was good. The lack of some basic facilities however really impacted on the quality of our stay. Half of the rooms in the hotel are directly next to a busy rail station, which as mentioned in other reviews is in use at all hours. Closing the window stopped some of the sound but not enough to stop sleep being disturbed. Even worse was the lack of air conditioning, which made the room on a summer night unbearable. Opening the window was of course not an option, Meaning a very poor nights sleep was experienced. Why build a hotel with no air conditioning right next to a rail line? Having stopped in a number of similar city hotels chains I was also suprised by the lack of towels, toiletries etc. Given the stupidly low price paid I dont feel I was completely had, but I would recommend to anyone paying full price to think twice about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTots
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Travelodge a few times due to working in London a couple of days a week and I have found it sufficient for my needs. It is very clean and the staff are very friendly. The location is central to everything you need for a stay on London. Depending on what room you get, you'll either have a bathroom with a tub and shower in the tub or just a shower. Also you need to be careful what side of the hotel you stay on as on side is overlooking the trainline and it can be quite noisy. All in all it's a nice hotel and for the price you can't grumble too much

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: ashley-sayer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few travelodge's in my time and this one was just as good as the rest. I booked well in advance and stayed on a Sunday night so only paid £15 for my room, which for London is a bargain. Previous reviews have mentioned no wardrobe, but there is a rail to hang clothes on so no problems there. I was lucky enough to have a room on the road side so cannot comment on the train noise, but there was an alarm sounding in the street on regular occasions, it was slightly annoying but stopped early evening. If your going out and about then I am pretty sure you won't notice it. Great links to the tube, with a station literally around the corner, very friendly staff and a clean yet compact room made for a comfortable stay. I am giving this 5 stars for the price I paid, if I paid upwards of £50 it would be around 4 stars as it is a little basic but still great for a solo traveller, not really romantic trip away material though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay again”
Reviews.Author: JPGSunderland
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. Close to tower hill tube station making our transfer from Kings cross easy. Asked for ground floor room as they have air con and it was needed as rooms got very hot. Minimal noise with us both sleeping in to 9am. Paid 45 pound for a night which is very good for London. Room was basic but what more do you want/need on a city break.

Reviews.Title: “average stay but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Essex_88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first weekend in August with a group of friends. We arrived at just after 2pm to see if we could leave our bags in a luggage room and then come back later on to check in. The receptionist said there was no where for them to store our bags and our rooms weren't ready so we would have to pay £10 per room for early check in if we wanted somewhere to put them. We went ahead and checked into one room early for an extra £10 to put all of our bags in and then checked into the rest when we came back later on in the afternoon. The location of the hotel is in fairly central London and is only a short walk to Tower Hill underground station. The rooms are quite small but seeing as we only used the hotel as somewhere to have a shower and sleep it wasn't too bad. Some of our groups rooms overlooked a busy railway and incurred a great deal of noise until late at night and from about 5am in the morning which wasn't ideal. I'd perhaps request a room on the other side of the hotel if you don't want some noise from trains. The beds were comfortable but the pillows were as flat as a pancake and there's one for each person in the room. They were also quite stingy on the towels. There were two bath towels and one hand towel. Again not ideal with two girls sharing a room with long hair. I went down to reception to ask for a couple more and it wasn't a problem for them to give me an extra couple. The bathroom was clean and the shower worked fine. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the food unfortunately. Overall for the price and location I can't really complain. They could just do with having a few more towels in the rooms, better pillows and a facility to leave your bags if you can't check in so you can go off and enjoy the city without having to lug a bag around or pay £10 to check in earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: opentrail
Reviews.Content: Central location. Friendly staff. Clean. Although next to a railway line with windows shut I heard nothing accept people on the inside corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and close to Underground station”
Reviews.Author: emmatt11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights and found it met our needs, it was basic but comfortable and clean, all we needed was somewhere comfy to sleep as we were busy sightseeing during the day. It was about a 5 min walk to the underground which obviously links you to wherever you want to go in London! Some people have complained about the noise but if windows were shut it was fine, we went when the temperature was 29 and it was hot but would be the same anywhere else, air cond would help, but we are not abroad!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Hoppinghedgehog
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during a recent work trip. The location is a mixed bag - albeit close to transport links, the hotel is squeezed between a busy street and train lines. Having said that, the noise from the train lines was not as loud as I thought it would be. The room was OK, with a good matress but no wardrobe or safe for valuables. The bathroom was small and the lack of toiletries slightly disappointing - I still feel the hotel should at least have provided a small bar of hand-soap. All in all a bit sparse for Central London prices. The breakfast was OK with a choice of hot English, cereal, toast etc. Not bad but not extraordinary either. The breakfast area felt more like a canteen, cold and impersonal. The salvation of this otherwise unimpressing hotel are its staff, both in reception and the breakfast room. They have gained this hotel its third star on this review and were decidedly the best thing about my experience there. Overall, an average hotel at a high price.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel But Very Noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: welshtraveller49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a trip to London with friends. It was perfectly fine for what we needed, the rooms were basic but spotlessly clean. We didn't need much else as we were so busy in the day we just wanted somewhere to crash at night. Please be warned though that this hotel is right next to the train tracks so it's extremely noisy!! It was hot while we visited London but we couldn't have the windows open at night because the noise was deafening from the trains. Unfortunately there was no air-con either. Sometimes we struggled to hear the TV in the mornings when we opened the windows because the trains were that loud. Also, on the Saturday night we stayed there was a lot of noise in the early hours of the morning from a group of teenagers/early 20's who thought it was funny to run up & down the corridors shouting to each other. We were also woken up at 7:00am by a young girl screaming & swearing at her boyfriend in the corridor for about an hour. We would have complained to reception but there are no phones in the rooms!! Fortunately, another guest went and told her to shut up! Whilst I appreciate that this was not Travelodge's fault, it would be good if the staff at the hotel could keep a better eye on security and comfort for their better behaved guests!

Reviews.Title: “Modern budget hotel very near Tower of London”
Reviews.Author: travellertopoland2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent one night in July, having room 313. The hotel is a modern building about 200 metres from the Tower Hill Tube Station. The location is excellent for visiting the Tower of London and was near a number of City business locations. I chose it as the cheapest hotel in the area on that night and was taken aback to pay £159. I have stayed elsewhere better for less money, but had no choice on the date. Having prepaid, I was able to use the auto-checkin which dispensed our key. The rooms on the 3rd floor required keycard access which enhanced security in a building which otherwise is open access. The bed was fine though the mattress could have been thicker. The bathroom had a walkin shower. This was easy to use and worked well. We did not have breakfast. In summary, location and sleep comfort were fine; but it was overpriced as a normal tariff

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BearPear
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is what saves it from a much lower rating. it is a two-minute walk to Tower Hill Tube and even closer to the DLR station. The hotel appears clean and tidy but on closer inspection the bedding in our room was tired and had old stains on the white linen. New bedding (or a bleach wash) would be welcome. As others have said the room was small, but fine if you are just using the hotel as a base and would be out all day as we were. We were also next to the railway line, but I wasn't bothered by the noise, and I am a light sleeper! The room was warm and a little uncomfortable on the first night, you could open the window, but the train noise would be increased. Now onto the truly awful and worst value aspect of the stay - the breakfast! How they would dare to advertise a Continental breakfast when there were only muffins & yoghurt today, or as a hot English with soggy bacon, sausage, "fake" scrambled eggs and beans in a dish with a ladle so hot it burnt your hands. Oh, and today there were cold, raw tomatoes. The toaster was one of those grills which takes the bread through a contraption under a heated element, the bread emerging with a very pale tan. Those who were brave enought to put the bread through again caused burning and a plume of smoke which enveloped the dining room. The highlight of the dining experience was one of the staff who was chatty and friendly and shared her expertise of the area to the visitors - she was an asset to the hotel, which really needs a few more positives to offer.

Reviews.Title: “only worthful below £40 pn”
Reviews.Author: CarlosMandy
Reviews.Content: I actually like this place. It is situated at a subleme location next to many public transport connections, as well the Bank Distric, Tower Bridge (and so the London City Hall and London Bridge). The RV1 bus to and from Covent Garden is class, the DLR station of Tower Gateway is within two minutes walk and Tower Hill tube station is about 5 mins walk. The rooms are basic, but clean and comfortable. However as my title states it is by far not worth anybit more then £40. You can get the cheapest rates if you take two nights starting on a Sunday, as I did. For two nights I paid £58. As I booked two single nights, both connected to each other but only that way I pay £29 pn (otherwise same room but with higher rate second night, huh?) and when i came back to my hotel on Monday afternoon I was not able to enter my room. When I was at the reception my two nights were not automatically registred for the same room, although it was corrected instantly. My luggage was still safe by the way, so nothing negative to report thankfully. I do will come here again, for the mentioned period of Sunday til Tuesday in the near future. A tip: when you travel with the two of you, book the room as a single person, only one checking in on arrival, as all rooms got a double beds. Otherwise you pay double tariffs

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Uncomfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: Semour_Butts
Reviews.Content: Bed was far too soft, room was far too hot, no aircon and if you opened the window you had the noise of the trains going past right outside the window. Plus the breakfast was usually cold and of a low quality. Other than that it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Laneham
Reviews.Content: Travelodges usually are not too bad - but this one is terrible. You have a choioce of a room overlooking four lanes of road traffic or four tracks of rail traffic - I got the trains. With no air conditioning on a warm day, do you keep the window open and not sleep or clopse the window and get too hot - and not sleep? When the bloke upstairs walked around, the room shook. It smelled of damp. Then I was woken up by the staff shouting at each other in the corridor at 5am. Breakfasty? The worst sawdust sausages ever (no wonder foreigners think UK cooking is awful) and no marmalade......

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: walkingsue
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. 3rd floor overlooking DLR and Fenchurch Street line. Weather hot around 33 degrees. Very concerned after reading previous reviews. Room big enough, Shower good. Both room and shower clean. Had window open for air and the trains were no problem. Room has no air conditioning but was not overly hot. Asked for an extra pillow, no problem. Only around 5 minutes from underground station. Had breakfast on 2 days, absolutely fine. All the staff we came into contact with were friendly and helpful. All in all will certainly recommend this travel lodge to friends and will return ourselves. Sue and Geoff

Reviews.Title: “Just about okay”
Reviews.Author: dawwai321
Reviews.Content: Hotel not far from tube station. Room clean and basic. Would not recommend eating in restaurant. Unfortunately, got there late and pouring with rain,so thought we'd try it. Food lukewarm, did not even eat mine, but my husband did and suffered later. Luckily he did not have any lasting effects. Would not recommend and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KateLondon_9
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge at Tower Hill is in a great location - right by the underground and major London sites. The rooms are VERY basic - no showel gel in room, sparcely decorated etc. The noise from the train tracks can be annoying. However, the rooms are clean and serve as a good base for exploring London. And the check-in and check-out was the most efficient I have ever experienced. Compared to other hotels in London this is one of the cheapest. However, it still seems fairly expensive at 80-90 pounds a night. For that place in other European cities you could get a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUT DONT ORDER BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: edd02
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy cant fault price or location noise not a problem tripple glazing worked well not too many places too eat nearby advise to eat elsewhere do not order breakfast food dire no taste and cheap ingredients weatherspoons across road does a better and cheaper breakfast overall a good base if visiting london

Reviews.Title: “Good value would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Toddy1953
Reviews.Content: Did not experience the noise problems reported by other guests. Found it to be conveniently located, well priced. Room was clean ate dinner in the resaurant meal was very good. Would stay there again & recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: peezap
Reviews.Content: great hotel good value for money nice friendly staff great location had fantastic two days

Reviews.Title: “cheap & cheerful but dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: grace186220
Reviews.Content: good location but is let down by the noise problems we stayed for two nights arrived late on friday night & checked in the receptionist was friendly , went to the room was very basic just a bed with small table & tea & coffee making facilites , but looked fairly clean , we went to bed about 12 ish but doors were constantly slamming people running up & down corridors shouting & talking on mobile phones so didnt get much sleep & then was woke early with more doors slamming & could hear the person next door hairdryer we went out so didnt eat any thing in the hotel i made the bed before leaving but when we got back could tell there were things moved from the bed so thought the bed had been changed but when going to bed that night realised the cleaner had just turned the duvet over as there were black marks on the duvet & was just turned over so not very good

Reviews.Title: “Great City Centre Hotel with problems through out”
Reviews.Author: Hayleigh-Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: I really feel sorry for this Travelodge, It has all the potential to be an amazing city centre retreat in London. The price, like many people have said, is fantastic for the location (literally 2 mins walk from the tower of London and the tube stop). However we found it completely unforgivable that the room has no air-con, plus we were unable to open the windows in our room. The temperature in the room was simply inhumane, It doesn't really matter how little you spend on a place, surely you should be entitled to a bit of a breeze whilst you sleep? Things that I've noticed throughout previous reviews including the soft bed, banging doors, train noises etc are all in existence however I quite liked the soft bed and the banging doors were annoying but I was doing so much with my days in London that I conked out as soon as my head hit the pillow and didn't really notice the banging until about 7am/8am in the morning when people were on the move for breakfast downstairs. Our room was located literally ON the train track however we never found the trains to be a bother as the latest we had to deal with them was about midnight. All my experiences with the hotel staff were pleasant. are check in/out was happy and straight forward and when I ordered drinks at the bar for our room the bar staff were very cheery and full of banter. Also there is a great pub called 'The Minories' across the road that does a cracking breakfast if you're not up for the travelodge brekky. I would recommend this hotel if you're stopping off for the night - as you simply can't beat the price in central London.
